website_summaries.verdict: An accurate, easy-to-mount sight marred by a few imperfections including so-so lens caps.
pros: Mounts securely and sights in accurately, and maintains its zero well
Very clear optics, and red dot is crisp and easy to see at all brightness settings
cons: Occasional quality-control issues can impact dot shape
Sturdier lens caps would be an improvement

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Going to range this week. Looks and feels like quality. I will update after the range and zero this week if I have any concerns. 5/25 - went to range. Zero was close out of the box. 200 rounds down range. Seemed to hold zero. So far, excellent optic. I will update if zero drifts. Note: 20 years military. This is as good as any of the high priced optics I used on uncle sams dime. 5/26 - range again today, 300 5.56 rounds, holding zero.
customer_reviews.author: Odie Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great optic for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great optic for the price. Red and green dot have five brightness settings and the dot itself is good. It fits great paired with a Tactical 3x magnifier on my S&W M&P15 sport 2. All you can ask for, for an optic in this price range. I would buy again and recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: bizzoby

customer_reviews.title: Got one with a defective dot. Mine did not ...
customer_reviews.text: Got one with a defective dot. Mine did not have a dot but a dash. Tried everything, remove battery, installed battery, increase/decrease illumination. Still had a dash. I tried to call the company number I found on google but phone would ring once then I get nothing. The email I got from Bobby, owner of Ozark Armament, did not have a contact number. Sorry but it goes back. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality control. Will no longer purchase anything from Rhino Tactical
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I needed to return this exact item with the same problem. When looking through the eyepiece you can see an inner seal has become unglued or has shifted internally on the lower right hand side. The same identical problem happened with the previous optic that I ordered from the same company. I have never ever had this problem with any product on Amazon or Ebay or anywhere online where I order the same product twice and they have the same identical defect.
customer_reviews.author: steelcurtain74578

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed... Red & green "dots" are blobs.
customer_reviews.text: I received the Rhino Tactical Green & red Dot today, took it out of the box, put the battery in, and attached it to a rifle to check it out. After turning it on I was very disappointed. The "Dot" is more like a star burst blob, the green is much worse than red, but both are unusable. There is a defined "dot" but it is surrounded by other lines, mainly going to the left. As a comparison, I have EOTech, Burris, Truglo, BSA and other less expensive red dot sights, and this is by far the worst "dot" I have seen. The unit will be going back.
customer_reviews.author: -KL

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The red dot isn't crisp but it's ok there is a glare at 9o'clock inside the optic. Quality feels great and shot 100rounds through it. The optic held zero at 50yards..what can I say you get what you pay for. Update: 04/10/17 This dot did better than I thought especially when you throw in a 3x magnifier. I went to the range and the some how the magnifier combine with this dot just became magic my accuracy became a lot better and shot a few times 75yards down range.
customer_reviews.author: CDT

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit on my Ruger AR556
customer_reviews.text: The fixed bolt to attach to the rails on my Ruger AR556 is too wide to fit in the slot on my rails. The mount (and thus the optic) will not sit flat on my rifle.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Lack of a true dot
customer_reviews.text: I should have reviewed the “1” ratings. The majority were due to the same reason as to why I have returned for a refund. When I installed the battery and turned the unit on I looked through the glass and discovered something that did not closely resemble a dot. Trying to describe what I saw would be a horizontal line with a irregular shaped blob close to the middle. Thought maybe the form was due to my glasses, but I had two more check it. Both have 20/20 vision and had similar explanations. After some thought, I decided to return due to what I personally determined was a flaw based on design and lack of quality control.
customer_reviews.author: E. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Lens cover doesn't stay closed kind of a pain
customer_reviews.text: Front cover cap does not stay shut after you open and close it a dozen times or less. Saw another review that mentioned it and thought was maybe a rare occurance and ordered it anyway. Guess it's not as rare as I thought. Other than that it was easy to sight in, mounted easily, and if you don't mind having to tie down the lens cover when not in use you should be happy. Although I don't know if I would buy it again. There are other sights for about the same money. May try one of those next time.
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy customer 1

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice sight, but durability was an issue.
customer_reviews.text: While it worked it worked great. Clear optics, nice red/green dot sights. Mount is very nice. The only problem I had is it only lasted a couple months then the left/right adjustment stopped working. In that time I had to take it off and remount it on my AR. Now I can't sight in, way to far left....
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality scope seemingly, but unable to mount properly.
customer_reviews.text: Sight does not want to sit on rail correctly. Was able to put the old one, and another red dot on the same spot with no issues at all. This one just doesnt seem to sit right, at all. There is an odd ridge on the bottom of the mounting bolt, and I am wondering if somehow the alignment of that can throw it off? Also the metal finish on the nut stripped off like butter. And no I did not hack at it, a well fit wrench should not do that either. Its dissapointing because the red/green dot and sight quality look pretty dang promising, if I was able to mount it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect budget red/green dot for .22lr
customer_reviews.text: I gave 5 stars for this because I got exactly what was described to me. This is a fantastic 0 magnification red/green dot sight for my .22lr AR pistol. The packaging was simple, the instructions were clear, and the set up was flawless. I torqued it down to 25 ft/lbs and zeroed in my rifle at 10yds. A few adjustments of windage (after unscrewing the knob), and I was ready to plink.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good product , for price......
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product. Came well packaged and in good condition. Upon installing battery, I noticed that the c-clip that holds battery cap together was not correct size. It was quite a bit larger than it should be. However, it does manage to hold everything together, and should be a non-issue. This type of thing is expected with Chinese manufactured products. I have run about 100 rounds of .223 55g rifle rounds through it so far. No issues at this time. A good value/dollar on my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: The Rhino Is A Must Have. If Your Looking For A Great Sight..
customer_reviews.text: Hi I'm Carbine Joey And I Purchased This Red Dot Sight For My VR-60 12 Guage Semiautomatic shotgun. And Since I have Seen It On A Few Web Site's For The Best 5 Or 10 Red Dot Sight's With A Budget In Mind I Had To Have It.. My Research Showed Me That This Sight Is Up There With Big Name Brands Like The Strikefire II And The Bushnell T25 And Many Others .. If You Do Your Research This Sight Is Very Well Made And Work's Great. I'm Very Pleased With This Red And Green Sight I'm Going To Pass These Out For My Friends At The Range There That Good..
customer_reviews.author: Carbine Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great site
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Red Dot I've owned and relied on customer reviews for the selection. Like the pop up covers. Sited in quickly but have to remember that it sites in the opposite way a scope does. Once sited, it was spot on out to 50 yards. At 75 yards, I shot a 1 inch group. At 100 yards (which is supposedly beyond its performance recommendations) I shot a 3 inch group. Not bad, I say. And that was just propping my elbow on the shooting table. Not in a brace. So that spread is most likely attributable to my movement.
customer_reviews.author: K. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Have used flip up sights and they where great however this Rhino red dot is horrible. I am sending this back. Pros: price, wieght, & look Cons: not a solid dot(several dots, what appears to be a thumbs up, & a line) and wouldn't even mount properly.
customer_reviews.author: MWhite

customer_reviews.title: Defective mount but I fixed it anyways.
customer_reviews.text: The mount looked fine but when I mounted it on a picatinny rail it rocked back and forth and would not tighten down correctly. The cross pin was too large and would not sit into the slots. I thought about sending it back but I wanted to finish my project so I corrected the pin size by filing two of the sides down a little until it sat in the slot the right way. Otherwise the mount seems well made. I'll see how good the red dot is as soon as I get a chance to shoot the gun.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: the sight has a nice weight to it
customer_reviews.text: I just took the rhino tactical green,red dot site to the range this morning. it took me around 12 rounds to shoot center. the sight has a nice weight to it, the green and red dots are very clear and not to big. I shot it at 25 yards to shoot center then 50 yards it held zero. I like the green over the red all thou there both good. the only thing is the bolt to hold it on my AR 15 would losen, but loctite blue will solve that. all in all so far its a great little scope and looks great to boot
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: shot this sight for around 300 rounds, and after my range session there was dust inside the front glass, and the sight kept flickering, due to a loose rotary switch retainer, kept loosening as we were shooting so the sight would periodically turn off and the only way to fix it was to screw the retainer back down which required me to remove the battery cover and battery 4-5 times over a few hours, I have since put some loctite on there and should be good now other than that, its a straight shooting sight, no issue holding a zero or target acquisition even out to roughly 280-300 Meters
customer_reviews.author: James A mccaulley

customer_reviews.title: Don't even think about it just get one, or six!!
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap!!!!! Way more than I was expecting for this price. I have boughten six yes six one for each of my AR-15s and one for my . 22, one for my sons .22 his .17hmr, his .410 and one for my Mossberg shotgun. Get one of these, you will not be disappointed!!! The build quality is absolutely amazing. These little red dots are completely waterproof and absolutely durable. They're worth 2 or maybe even three times as much as the asking price. They hold up to the recoil of pretty much any standard cartridge from 22 long rifle to 12-gauge 3in mags.
customer_reviews.author: Segruts nairb

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this dot and I like the company. I have purchased 3 different items from them now and I broke a piece on a flip up iron sight (all on me), and they not only replaced the part but sent me a second part for a back up. That is awesome customer service. This dot is on a 9mm AR pistol. It stays zeroed after hard use and storage. Battery life is good. I have NO complaints. I like that they are a US company even if they may get parts or import from China (I don't know if they do , but who doesn't these days).
customer_reviews.author: J Hardin

customer_reviews.title: I was going to return it... SO glad I kept it.
customer_reviews.text: Originally my complaint was abotu a blurry dot, it's not. I was testing it indoors, off fo the rifle, and way too close to my face. I have this on my C308, and I just got tot range it today, at 50y I was keeping WELL within a 4" target, not benchrested, and taking little time ro re-aquire the target. (testing for a defense situation). That said, my rifle managed to destroy a SIG-TAC CP1, and an hkparts 4x prismatic... this one held together, held zero, and now lives permanently on the rifle. It's earned the name "Rhino" that ozark gave it.
customer_reviews.author: J Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of this sight and will expand on this review after the upper it's for is delivered. Brightness is very good. The only issue I have is the dot is more of a dash than a dot. Seeing how this type of sight isn't made for precision shooting that may not make any difference. I will need to mount and use it before I can make that determination. As long as I can keep a 4" group at 100 yards I will be plenty satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: DNS Guns

customer_reviews.title: Gonna put it thru its paces....👍
customer_reviews.text: Seller states that it'll hold up to a .50 cal...and they're looking for something bigger....welp, well see....not quite as big as a .50, but I'm gonna try it on my S&W 14"460XVR....a heckuva test for an alleged heckuva optic...will post a follow-up after... Follow up.....welp.....it actually held up, for about 11 rounds...after that, the light was on, but no reflection. Maybe for a long gun, but a 14" 460 has a bit of a jolt...😁. I can't complain, inexpensive and I think the 460 was a bit overkill. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Still here...still

customer_reviews.title: For the money, it holds a solid zero on an AR
customer_reviews.text: Like others ha and mentioned it will come loose without some locktite, however, if you use locktite, mine has been stable for the 300 rounds I've put through it. Holds zero great at 100 yrd sight in, and adjustments have solid clicks. I did notice that at least two of the Ring mount screws/Allen keys are stripped out, however it holds tight even so. For the price I would purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Zeno

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a new unit, BUT ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a new unit. Everything about this purchase suggests used product recycled as new ... dings on cantilever, scotch taped battery packing, other cosmetic anomalies. As for the coated optics .... besides mirroring, can't really see any obvious coatings; glare is pretty rough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Drone

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, sloppy mount.
customer_reviews.text: So this red dot scope feels solid looks good, I doubt it will hold zero because after tightening to the point that one more quarter turn would likely strip the threads I can still push it forward and back almost a quarter inch. I have it mounted on my Stevens 320 security 20 gauge shotgun so I basically purchased it for the looks. In summary if you want a serious red dot I wouldn't buy it, for the price it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: William c shreves

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive rugged, red/green dot that will not break the bank
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for an inexpensive red/green dot that is a bit more rugged. This Ozark Rhino fits my needs perfectly. Zero'd in on my PCC within 10 rounds. then shot 300 rounds with no issues. It held zero fine. Clearly this is a price performer and definitely recommend. Will try and remember to come back in 6 months/year to update. 31 Dec 2018 update --- Let a couple of buddies borrow my Ruger PCC with the Ozark Rhino mounted. They shot about 1500 rounds of +P ammo with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hom

customer_reviews.title: I recommend using the smallest dot to zero and keep on ...
customer_reviews.text: Can see all the dots perfectly in the daylight. I recommend using the smallest dot to zero and keep on smallest while using it for whatever reasons. The larger dots are kind of a cluster and doesn't serve as an accurate sight. The price you pay for it is great. I paid 49.99 and I would purchase another if I needed one. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mounting pin problem
customer_reviews.text: I can't really give a good review until next hunting season however I did have a problem mounting the scope on the mounting rail on my crossbow. The supplied mounting pin was too thick for the notches on my crossbow mounting rail. Fortunately I had a mounting pin that was thinner and worked to mount on my rail. I liked the green dot better than the red dot and it was very easy to sight in. I like the built in scope covers and the on off/brightness adjustment on the side instead of on top as it is less exposed to impact damage.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Nice Scope. Nice Price Point.
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a Ruger Single Shot 308. Works perfectly. With a purchase of Rugers Picatinny Rail for their rifle and the Scopes catilever design all works out well. Got a email from Ozark Armament checking up on my purchase of their scope. Nice personal touch. Scope appears to be a nice quality build. Doesn't look/feel "cheesy"
customer_reviews.author: rrpete

customer_reviews.title: Rhino Tactical Green/Red Dot Sight - Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. It does not stay tight on the rail. Even when a gunsmith tightened it for me, after shooting 3 or 4 magazine loads, it loosened up -- then obviously you are off the mark. In addition, it doesn't seem to stay sighted in even when its still secure on the rail. I have been to the range several times to try and sight in, but to no avail. I have other red dot scopes (not this brand) and have not had this kind of trouble. Will go back to open sights for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: Randy & Lora

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed a dot sight that could handle recoil and decided to spend a little more on the Rhino and stay away from the cheap $20 sights. It's solidly built and the red and green dots are the perfect size and have good brightness levels The elevation and windage turrets have a generous amount of adjustment, and have solid clicks to them. I love the large 35mm tube; makes for fast target acquisition. The flip open caps are a nice touch. Uses a common CR2032 battery that's easy to find. Well worth the extra money spent.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ochiai

customer_reviews.title: Sits Crooked on Rail, Difficult to Sight
customer_reviews.text: Currently, I keep this sight off my rifle due to the fact that when fully tightened, the mount sits crooked on the rail. Rail is straight. I've also had a pretty difficult time getting this sighted correctly. Co-Witnessed Irons work flawlessly, not sure why the Red Dot won't sight in. Dot is crisp with a tad bit of glare, I'd give it 5 stars for build quality and feel. If only I could get it to mount flush to match my Irons.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Good sight and price to match
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine. I put it on an ar15. It took a while to figure out how much to turn the dials and in which direction, but I eventually got it zeroed in. Though it does seem like the bolt that keeps it on sometimes wiggles a little loose. Other than that it works just fine. They emailed me about the product and I told them this. They are now gonna ship me a new mount to fix the problem. TOP NOCH CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Davis

customer_reviews.title: not worth the savings
customer_reviews.text: what should i have expected for $40....not much but i was hoping it would at least get on paper. I couldn't get the scope to zero after 50 rds. shots placement was erratic at best. I had the rifle benched so at best only a harsh trigger pull would have effected it. Just to verify it wasn't me I removed the dot and used my iron sights and was on target at 100 yds. This was a super budget build so i didn't want to spend more on my optic then my upper but looks like i will be anyways
customer_reviews.author: Angel A.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have to say the product is durable as I watched the postal driver drop it out the window of his delivery truck onto a concrete sidewalk. Product was easy to install and dial in with the use of a bipod. I can vouch for the accuracy as I can put a hole through a penny at 35 yards. If I did have a minor complaint is the dot size is a little large which might interfere with accuracy at 100 yards. Otherwise this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: CT Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Great Sight at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This red/green dot sight is well made and appears very sturdy. The flip up lens covers are great. The only flaw in design appears to be using a flat blade screw driver to adjust zero. Most sights use hex fittings which make it easier to adjust since one doesn't need to concentrate on holding the screwdriver n place while adjusting zero. This could easily be corrected in future manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet taken the sight to the range for testing. The sight arrived on time and is functioning correctly: it has green and red reticles with adjustable brightness. It is easy to mount and to remove. It feels solid and strong. I will test it as soon as possible. Based on other reviews and my fist impressions, I expect it to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Don N.

customer_reviews.title: Fits great on a Ruger Mk III and ez to turn onn/off
customer_reviews.text: Fit great on my Ruger MkIII pistol. I got this to dispatch a skunk in our back yard at night. one reviewer said why put this on a pistol and this is why. In the dark with just the outside lights on I could see the skunk but not the black iron sights so this puppy should be a big help. The one bold clamp works great, I have a two bolt one from another company and the bolts do not fit in the rail that came with the Ruger so this one is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for close range
customer_reviews.text: This product is Ok at best. It does work and it is fairly easy to zero in but it is impossible to get a tight group at 100 yards. We were shooting at a 1foot x 1foot metal plate and the dot covered the whole plate. I orignially thought this had zoom but I guess I read the discription wrong my fault. Purchased another scope today but this company with zoom and cross hairs so we shall see how that works. Does look bitchen on the gun though and would be perfect if you don’t plan on shooting over 25 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel green

customer_reviews.title: NOT that good
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to zero, windage and elevation hardly do anything, don't matter how much you turn the adjustments, also the dot is very fuzzy, (and NO I don't have astigmatism or glaucoma) Tried my best to make it work, but had no luck. Maybe I got a defective one, but anyway, it will end up inside a drawer or a box in my basement because I'm not willing to go thru the hassle to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Aguiar

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Great sight for the money. I have the ozark sight and a name brand that cost me 150 bucks more than the ozark. I am not a professional shooter. Both sights appear to be of the same quality. As far as I am concerned the Ozark sight fits my needs very well and wish I had found it before I dropped 200 on the name brand. I could have bought 4 Ozark sights for the same price I paid for the name brand sight. I highly recommend the Ozark especialy if you need a good cheap reliable sight for plinking.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Maddox

customer_reviews.title: I just
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sight to use on an Anderson AR-15, and share it with a 2019 Ruger 10-22 carbine. Both rifles have 20mm picatinny rails to mount the Ozark sight. I have targets set up 20 meters away, but cannot zero in. Bullets strike 15 inches low, and left,. Cannot adjust to fix. l I discarded the box, so I can't return to Amazon. I am very disappointed! I just kept thinking there was someway I could get this nice looking sight working! WRONG!
customer_reviews.author: Old Weedhopper Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to the range and get it mounted on my new AR-15. Used a laser bore sight to dial in the settings. I've bought both the red/green dot scope along with iron sights. It seems the dial adjustments were backwards, but I was nevertheless able to connect the dots. The scope seems to be very consistent and is very sturdy on the top rail. The iron sites have a horizontal adjustment, but no vertical. Overall I'm very pleased. Though I'm a novice in the sport of shooting, for the price point, these are really good products!
customer_reviews.author: C. Chad Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It feels very very sturdy and looks like a very expensive sight
customer_reviews.text: This Sight is GORGEOUS. It feels very very sturdy and looks like a very expensive sight. i have no downsides to it at all. it has 4 stars until i can take it to the range and see if it holds its zero. Update* I have just purchased my second of these sights, They are very great and sturdy sights i have taken mine to the range several times and after some adjustments it has held zero well on my 5.56. only trouble i had was second sight was delivered with a small crack on the dust cover which ozark sent out a replacement immediately. Sight 5/5 Ozark customer service 10/5
customer_reviews.author: Joey Broquist

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT Budget Optic!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect on my AR with a front sight post. It stays where you zero it. Mainly, due to my vision needs, a crisp green dot is far more easy for me to quickly sight on than a red one. The Dragon Lady, on the other hand, has a habit of buying green paper targets "Because they're pretty", so she keeps changing it back to red when she shoots. The result is the constant working of the knob back and forth, and it works like a champ! Kudos on another great product and personalized service Ozark Armament!
customer_reviews.author: pawpaw

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price range.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way that it fits on my SAI Saint .556 Bravo very well. The visibility of the reticle is quite nice as well. The lens caps fit well and for the price, it seems like a very good build for such a cheap reflex sight. It's a bit hefty but the quality of production seems quite nice. I haven't been able to sight it at a range or have fired with it attached yet since I've been too busy with work, but I will redact this comment when I have done so.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Dead on.
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't respond to reviews but in this case I feel it is needed. The scope is all and more than I expected. Sighted it in yesterday and shot 100 rounds through my AR 223. Nothing moved and very consistent groups. Also like the fact that 2 batteries are provided with purchase of this scope. Highly recommend and will purchase through this vendor again. Keep up the great work.
customer_reviews.author: treestand

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The sight was broken and had electrical tape hanging on the inside of the scope.
customer_reviews.author: Gage Luse

customer_reviews.title: Introductory scope
customer_reviews.text: Just received the scope so I have only unboxed and tested it; not on my AR yet. The dimmest red dot is clear, the brighter you turn it the more it distorts. The green dots are all distorted to me, regardless of brightness. I'm not going to be negative about it though, because I have an astigmatism in my left eye which most surely affects it. Packaging was good, and if course prime got it here fast. I think it will be a good introductory red dot, I wasn't expecting an ACOG!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought my first AR and was in the market for a red dot sight and my buddy recommended this sight and I have to tell you now i know why he swore by it, you just cannot beat the price for the quality your getting I love it. Really good product definitely going to be coming back for more of the products.
customer_reviews.author: bradyc999

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed and Love mine.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box I was super impressed. Clear optic, almost zero'd in from the factory. I will probably buy a couple more for popping holes in paper with the wife and kids. I do not if I would recommend this as a duty optic or in competition but I'm just a chubby dad that works in a office who has a weird fetish for piecing together budget ARs in my spare time. It works for me and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Arae Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: You get more than you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I went with this sight because I saw 2 different reviews that rated it in their top 10 red dots. They were correct. This is an excellent sight, at even a higher price.
customer_reviews.author: MSgt of Marines

customer_reviews.title: Great product at great price
customer_reviews.text: Great optic i purchased while waiting to afford a high end one....but after using this one decided not to "upgrade". Great quality with amazing fit and finish. Dots can be green or red and have various brightness settings. Have only abouy 500 rounds through it but is still holding zero just fine. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Great little red dot
customer_reviews.text: Added this red dot to a diamondback db15. This is my first red dot and over all I'm pretty happy with it. Didn't take much to sight in at 50yds and groupings were consistent. My only complaint is that the dot seems large it will cover a 4" target ot 50 yards. Ran out of ammo or I would have taken it out to 100yds. I did notice that I had no fogging issues with this red dot, range finder I was using at the time fogged up immediately. Seems to be a really solid red dot especially for the money, for an entry level price I don't think you can go wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zambrana

customer_reviews.title: Ozark Armament is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My first red dot for my first AR. I've taken it to the range twice and had few problems getting it set up on the rifle. I really like the option of red or green dot, to accommodate light conditions, as well as the range of dot sizes available. While I've been very pleased with the sight, I'm even more pleased with the responsiveness of Ozark Armament. I've had lots of questions (because this is my first red dot sight), and they have responded to each, with very helpful answers, within a day or two. I would not hesitate to purchase from them again!!
customer_reviews.author: Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two, both had the same defect.
customer_reviews.text: Seems built well, but ordered two of these to put on my sons' ARs and both had a red hazy reflection on the right side of the optics. Looked like internal reflections in the lenses, I'm not really sure. Regardless, it was unacceptable. Both copies were exactly the same. Returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Campin' Cowpoke

customer_reviews.title: Rather surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Shipped very fast,well packaged. Built very well, rather surprised! Took a little while to sight in(mounted on a Hi point .45 carbine at 30 yards). Once sighted and learned how to use , was grouping 1.5" at 30 yards from a rest. Will probably get a second one for .22 squirrel gun.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Pattrin

customer_reviews.title: Rhino Tac Dot
customer_reviews.text: Can't really complain for $40 dollars, it is usable for target shooting, it has some glare on higher settings, but if you are just looking for something to get from one end of the range to the other without breaking the bank then I would recommend..also the build quality far exceeded my expectations..
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Looked good but broke 3rd round.
customer_reviews.text: Felt sturdy, sight was clear, mounted with ease. I was impressed until I tried to sight it in an it wouldn't. Then I shot with it and it just quit intermittently. Customer service is non existent I would not buy or recommend. Update...... Customer service was spot on I however failed to check my email. They attempted to make this right I was the problem. I would give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money. Mounted it immediately but have not had a chance to zero it at the range. The dot is so so... not great. The low setting is as close to a tight red dot as you can get. On the high setting it spreads out like a disco ball to the size of a thumb tack. Not sure I will like that on target. I will see how it holds up on the range.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnn Newhouse

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this installed on my ak-47 and I think I have it zeroed. I haven't taken it to the range yet but I will update the review once I do. Overall the build quality seams solid. I only have a minor comments. The dot looks like it's not round like the adjustment on the illuminator lense (the part that shines the dot) is a little out of focus but not major.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Tisdale

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product. I have an astigmatism that distorts the dot so much that I cannot use it. Don’t let that bother you because I cannot use any red dots. I have tested all of the Vortex and some other pricier brands and I get the exact same result as with this one. If it wasn’t for that it would be on my AR today.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality control
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality control. Please look at the picture. Looking right through the scope, 1/3 of the glass is obscured by a piece of black plastic or metal. Why would anyone put such a defect in a box? Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: does its purpose, just not all that well
customer_reviews.text: it is in fact a red or green dot.. however, they sometimes ghost on the lens and make it hard to find center. the height is a but high. but it can be dropped to adjust. Not super good at holding a setting. A simple banging on the side of the rifle will cause it too lose 0. shop around before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny_Honest

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Good quality for price!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for cowitnessing an AR-15. Slapped it on the M & P Sport 2 and it was already lined up with the sites. Unfortunately, I then put it on my 9 mm carbine and really had to adjust it. I got it dialed in with a 10 round magazine. It took that long because I was counting each click as 1/4 inch. It might be 1/8 or 1/16, I'm not sure, I never read the directions, so I wasted three or four rounds - goes to show this thing is easy to set up. The dot is large, but for quick acquisition of man size targets at a hundred yards or less you can't beat this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for airsoft!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these separately for my airsoft rifles and they’re absolutely amazing! I would easily mount this on a AR style 22LR. I’ve not even come close to using it on anything else so I can’t vouch for its strength dealing with recoil from a medium/large caliber. As far as airsoft goes don’t waste the money on an expensive sight THESE ARE PERFECT
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great red dot.
customer_reviews.text: This red dot is excellent especially for the price. Holds zero perfectly. Had it for 4 yrs now. Sometimes I forget to turn it off and sits for a couple days in the on position. I'm still using the same battery I first put in 4 yrs ago. I'm getting 1 moa at 100 yrds with this thing. It's been on an ar15 and just recently put this on a 300blk. Its still holding zero. I would highly recomend.
customer_reviews.author: dawn allsup

customer_reviews.title: ... the range yet but sighting in the basement I like the feel
customer_reviews.text: Have not taken to the range yet but sighting in the basement I like the feel. It will take two trips to the range to do a full review. One trip to zero, next trip to see how the zero held. My experience with scopes in this price range is they may not hold the zero, when I find one that will it is a new jewel. Will update later. By the way it is going on a .300 blackout. Planning on a 150m zero with 125gr supersonic and them checking out the 100m with the subsonic and then testing the 115gr.
customer_reviews.author: FGB

customer_reviews.title: Dot becomes a fuzzy line at higher brightness settings
customer_reviews.text: For the money, I guess this is not a bad option. At the lower brightness settings, it provides a pretty tight dot, but as you increase the brightness, the dot becomes a fuzzy line. I haven't taken it to the range to zero and will update my review after that.
customer_reviews.author: J Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: For the money this thing is great. Took about 10 shots to zero it, but after that at 25 yards I was shooting a 2 inch grouping. Love the rise on it. Makes it very easy for target acquisition. Planning on adding a 3x magnifier to the back of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Ozark Armament, the REAL DEAL!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a very nice scope for very little money. The quality is comparable to Sightmarks red/green dot for half the money. Very fast shipping, and the customer service is some of the best on the web! They follow the process thru, from beginning to end to make sure your experience was what you expected! Thanks Ozark Armament! I'll be back....
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN DEFORGE

customer_reviews.title: Decent red dot for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to zero in to co-witness with the MBUS sights on my M&P 2. Seems to maintain zero regardless of number of rounds. Have yet to knock it around, so that will be the next test. Only con I noticed was that the shape of the dot (either using red or green) distorts if the brightness is turned up too far. Dot is actually bright enough for me at lower setting, so distortion isn’t a bother. Good deal & seems well made. I would recommend it for those on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you really need to save $30 or so.
customer_reviews.text: Great and fairly accurate. No literature or markings made it pretty tough to zero in. The dot is a little large for my liking. At 100 yards the dot is larger than the bullseye. Dialed in about as best as can be. Hunting season will be the final judge. I feel it's extremely overpriced. Top manufacturers are selling for not much more but with much more features.
customer_reviews.author: kenny defranco

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope, but dot is not as sharp as others I have seen
customer_reviews.text: I was a disappointed and how sharp the dot Was on the glass. It looks to me like a blur not a sharp red or green dot, Like I had imagined it would be. The mounting and design of the scope is great, however I may be returning it in search of a scope with better clarity if the green or red dot.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Few issues does not tighten down very well..mounted on TR imports se122 shotgun was lose and wobbly after a out 5 rounds..really great price but remember you get what you pay for. Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Killer deal for the price and build quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my girlfriend’s 16” AR. It’s very well made and clean construction. It looks great and the option of green and red is nice. For the price, and functionality, I can’t imagine wanting to buy a $500 sight after this. I got it boresighted and it was almost true out of the box. Great stuff
customer_reviews.author: Steven Mattix

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted and sighted in, pretty accurate at 100 yards. Put a hundred rounds through my AR and it stayed accurate. No an aimpoint but definitely not bad for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rippablo

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: this sight rocks! built like a tank......and does exactly as intended. using it on my crosman panther dpms sbr and its nothing but cool. More features than you could ask for for 40 bucks. this is my 3rd purchase from this company and they reach out and really care what you think. It wont be my last purchase for sure.
customer_reviews.author: T Bone

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this piece of junk to my AR15 and put about 100 rounds through it. The pin holding the rear lens cover vibrated out and now the mount ring is loose and rotates around the sight body. The red dot isn't bright enough to use in daylight. Plain old not happy with this cheapo hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Scroggin

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT ALL AROUND!!!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT!!! it a exactly what I was looking for... a bit raised so its easier to aim for me with a full facemask on. Was almost zeroed in when I got it. Had to turn one a quarter way and it was done.... I would recommend this to anyone that is looking for a good sight for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Not yet installed
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet installed the sight on my rifle, but it appears to be well made and seems to work well. Both the red and green dots appear clearly. I will be installing it next week and taking it to the range.
customer_reviews.author: Tom A Rudd

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sight for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this scope doesn't cost 5 times as much. Easy to install, easy to lower 1/3 co-witness and sight. Glass is clear, dot is easy to acquire in bright daylight. Took it to the range the first day, about 200 rounds later still right on target.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my S&W Sport 2 integrated with the stock sights. Stays on centered and easy on the eyes. Wish I would have ordered it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L.

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it tight to the railing... May be my problem, but I sure can't figure it out.
customer_reviews.text: I have had terrible terrible getting this scope tight to the railing. It wiggles...
customer_reviews.author: Drew Hall

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sight even better customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sight, it was clear and sturdy, with the option of either red or green. I had an issue but not because of the sight but because it didn't fit my Hi-Point 995TS, the customer service though was great, found a solution, had to get a riser and it worked out well. I will just have to change my rail later on so I don't have to use a riser and put flip up sights to co-witness. Overall great sight and customer service
customer_reviews.author: gcbuhay0609

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. Mounted on an AR-
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product . Mounted on an AR-.22. I have shot it several times and it still holds zero. I like the red/green option and each color has 5 different brightness settings. No auto cutoff though , so don't forget to turn it off which is easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: bmiles

customer_reviews.title: K
customer_reviews.text: Nice scope my only problem whit it is the low setting still very bright I mount it on a shotgun for deer hunting deer move really early or late evening so the brightness won’t let you concentrate on target.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact sight
customer_reviews.text: Sight looks well made and was easy to mount on my Browning Buckmark. Still working out the zero as I am conflicted to zero range. 50 or 75 yds for squirrel elimination. Would recommend product to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Damnford

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and great quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, this Red/Green Dot is great. I bought it as part of a combo scope. It is bright, clear and very easy to install. Fit my AR perfectly and was easy to sight in. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Longhurst

customer_reviews.title: SUPER !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been totally enjoying my super bad Ozark Armament Rhino Red Dot Sight. This sight is accurate, durable, and possesses ideal features. It's great for CQB and mid-range targets. Can't beat it for the price either !!!
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Moore

customer_reviews.title: I think this is the best scope I every bought
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best scope I every bought.the quality is beyond reproach,these people did there homework.and keep the price down of this otherwise very expensive piece of equipment. thanks to Ozark Armament
customer_reviews.author: Emily Stygler

customer_reviews.title: View Clear, Dot slight starburst,  appeared constructed well
customer_reviews.text: bought 5 mo ago finally got around to mounting on AR-15 for a Hog hunt it and it will not zero removed/remounted Bore sighted 2 other guns same time no problems. Lots of Great Reviews Though! Waited to long to return thumbs down!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This was the second one I purchased. I mounted it on a Smith & Wesson M&P 15 22. Worked like a champ. Took about 6 shots to zero it in. Put the next 15 rounds in a 2" circle at 25 yds. freehand. That should spell bad news for a lot of squirrels. Recommend this highly. My 1st one is on a AR15. I haven't sighted this one yet. Waiting for the mid-west weather to warm a little. The ar needs an outdoor range. Targets out to 100 yds.
customer_reviews.author: ted lowry

customer_reviews.title: Works like it's supposed to....
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a little AR--22 Plinkster my kids use for target practice. Once we got it sighted in, it worked like it was supposed to. These shots were standing with no bracing from 50 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M. Crotwell

customer_reviews.title: Broke after second shot
customer_reviews.text: Well I took a shot and missed. Product failed after the second shot. Internal part that I can't reach to fix/replace. You may get a bad one, you may get a good one. It's a risk you'll take.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my AR-15 and really like it so far! But I am giving 5 stars now due to their customer service. When my original order arrived, there was a tiny spec of debris on the glass. Tried using the cleaning cloth to remove it but it just wouldn't come off. I emailed the company with a picture of the imperfection and they immediately sent me another one! Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Low price but good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Nice Red Dot For the price. Includes an extra battery also. Well constructed with a good mount. It works in bright daylight and hold zero. I'm using it on an AR style pistol with a brace.
customer_reviews.author: Budrow

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my KSG12 and it seems to work very well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Ozark Armament Rhino Red Dot Sight - Green Dot Sight - Includes Picatinny Mount - Co-Witness - Reflex Rifle Sight
feature_bullets: GUARANTEED LIFETIME DURABILITY: Every sight from Ozark Armament is backed by our hassle-free LIFETIME GUARANTEE. Our sights are so durable we practically beg our customers to abuse them. We are a US company with real support: if you need help with our products we’re here for you.

CO-WITNESS CAPABILITY OUT OF THE BOX: Designed to co-witness perfectly with the included cantilever mount with any Ozark Armament iron sight or standard iron sights. The Rhino is easy to sight in and will hold a zero even after thousands of rounds.
RED OR GREEN DOT WITH ADJUSTABLE BRIGHTNESS: Five different brightness with green and red settings allowing you to shoot from dusk, day time, dawn, or night time.

ULTRA RUGGED, WATERPROOF & FOG PROOF: Sealed optic to prevent dust and moisture from getting inside. Nitrogen purged to prevent fogging. The Rhino Red Dot is guaranteed to work in any condition you’d find on Earth and probably even Mars!
UNPARALLELED ACCURACY & QUICKNESS : Excels in short and medium range shooting with 4 MOA accuracy. Get on target at incredible speed with the parallax design and wide field of view.
